title: Creating a reading list of 20 articles on information extraction (IE) that covers recent progress in robustness, generalization, fine-grained labels, and indirect supervision involves selecting influential and representative works from the field. Hereâ€™s a curated list of articles up to 2022 that you might find useful
Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding"** by Jacob Devlin et al
- While not exclusively about IE, BERT has significantly influenced the field, including robustness and generalization
**"SpanBERT: Improving Pre-training by Representing and Predicting Spans"** by Mandar Joshi et al
note: - Focuses on span-level predictions, which are crucial for fine-grained IE tasks.

title: **"A Survey on Recent Advances in Named Entity Recognition from Deep Learning models"** by Yadav and Bethard (2019) - Provides an overview of NER, a key IE task, with insights into robustness and generalization
**"Fine-tuning Pre-trained Language Models for a Better Performance on Named Entity Recognition"** by Lin et al
- Discusses methods to enhance NER performance, addressing robustness and fine-grained labels
**"Learning with Noisy Labels for Robust Named Entity Recognition"** by Shang et al
- Explores techniques to handle noisy data, improving robustness in IE
**"CrossWeigh: Training Named Entity Tagger from Imperfect Annotations"** by Wang et al
- Focuses on improving NER with imperfect annotations, relevant to indirect supervision
**"Distant Supervision for Relation Extraction via Piecewise Convolutional Neural Networks"** by Zeng et al
- A foundational work on using distant supervision for relation extraction
**"Improving Distantly Supervised Relation Extraction using Word and Entity Based Attention"** by Lin et al
- Enhances distant supervision techniques with attention mechanisms
**"Fine-Grained Entity Typing with High-Multiplicity Assignments"** by Abhishek et al
- Addresses the challenge of fine-grained entity typing
**"Label Noise Reduction in Entity Typing by Heterogeneous Partial-Label Embedding"** by Ren et al
note: - Focuses on reducing label noise in fine-grained entity typing.

title: **"Robust Text Classification under Confounding Shift"** by Hendrycks et al
- Discusses robustness in text classification, applicable to IE tasks
**"Generalizing to Unseen Domains: A Survey on Domain Adaptation for Natural Language Processing"** by Ramponi and Plank
note: - Covers domain adaptation, crucial for generalization in IE.

title: **"Learning to Generalize to Unseen Domains via Memory-based Multi-Source Meta-Learning for Named Entity Recognition"** by Wu et al
note: - Explores meta-learning for domain generalization in NER.

title: **"Fine-Grained Information Extraction from Biomedical Literature Based on Knowledge-Enriched Abstract Meaning Representation"** by Zhang et al
note: - Focuses on fine-grained IE in the biomedical domain.

title: **"Indirect Supervision for Relation Extraction using Question-Answer Pairs"** by Levy et al
- Utilizes QA pairs for indirect supervision in relation extraction
**"Robustness to Spurious Correlations in Text Classification via Automatically Generated Counterfactuals"** by Kaushik et al
note: - Discusses robustness techniques relevant to IE.

title: **"Fine-Grained Entity Typing by Knowledge-Enhanced Contextual Attention"** by Zhang et al
- Enhances fine-grained entity typing with contextual attention
**"Improving Fine-Grained Entity Typing with Entity Linking"** by Onoe and Durrett
- Combines entity linking with fine-grained typing for improved performance
**"Learning from Context or Names? An Empirical Study on Neural Relation Extraction"** by Peng et al
- Investigates the balance between context and entity names in relation extraction
**"Indirect Supervision for Relation Extraction Using Question-Answer Pairs"** by Levy et al
- Explores using QA pairs for indirect supervision in relation extraction
These articles provide a comprehensive overview of the recent advancements in information extraction, focusing on robustness, generalization, fine-grained labels, and indirect supervision
